It goes without saying the original Incredibles is fantastic. It's a stylish, well paced, smart, and funny family movie that has respect for its audience. It also has a tone to it that's extremely unique to the genre that really invests and intrigues. 
Incredibles 2, however, goes with a more traditional animated kids movie tone. In that sense, the movie works fine, but that's just the issue. The movie doesn't give the watcher anything cool or unique. It's just a really well animated movie, with pretty lackluster comedy and characters. 
The visuals are by far the highlight. The movie looks great and the visual humor, for me, is the only comedy that works. Some character designs and facial expressions are extremely funny to look at. The choreography in the action scenes are also fantastic. The fast paced and stylish action is pretty great in most scenes. 
This only goes so far, however. The sometimes cringe worthy dialogue, the bland story, the obvious twist (in my opinion), it just seems so wasteful. The writing is basically interchangeable with pretty much any other Pixar, Dreamworks, or Blue Sky movie, which Is really sad, because of the originals sharp and smart dialogue. 
It's comprable to Kubo and The Two Strings, except that movie looks much better and is occasionally really sweet and heartfelt. 
In my mind, it's somewhat sad that the movie is getting the acclaim it's getting. I'd rather see a movie that tries something new and falls flat than another text book animated kids movie. I still had an enjoyable time and the movie has a place due to the audience it clearly has, but it's showing Pixar that they can get away with lazy writing and lack of their so missed style.

title: It's extremely underwhelming and one of Pixar's worst efforts.
review: Brad Bird often stated that he would only make a sequel to 'The Incredibles' (2004) if he could come up with a story that was just as good as, or better than, that of the original. Sorry Brad, but I don't think that using the exact same story again really counts. Seriously, 'Incredibles 2' has pretty much beat-for-beat the same plot as the original, only with worse dialogue, much worse characters, and far worse motivations for the villain. In the first ten minutes or so, the film completely goes back on the character arcs of the original and basically resets the story, so that the exact same plot can play out again. Instead of expanding on the original, it actually takes away from it which is very disappointing. That's a good word to sum 'Incredibles 2' up: disappointing. There wasn't a chance that this one would actually be better than the original, but the fact that it doesn't even come close, and that it's definitely one of Pixar's worst efforts, is actually rather surprising. The two plot-lines that we cut between during the film don't really blend together all that well, and therefore the film feels disjointed. Personally, I think that the best moments of the film are those that explore Bob's relationship with Jack-Jack, however these moments are underdeveloped and the exploration of Jack-Jack's powers begins to lack logic as the many powers that he gains start to become illogical with his supposed 'polymorph' power. However Jack-Jack does provide some of the film's best moments, especially a scene involving a raccoon. The voice-cast are fine, but there's nothing noteworthy in that department. The best pieces of music are taken straight from the first, and the new stuff that Michael Giachinno brings is underwhelming and forgettable. The action scenes are, for the most part, well done and deliver some sort of entertainment, however there's always the underlying sense that we've seen it all before. This film claims to be something different, that it is better than the recent bulk of similar superhero flicks, when in reality it is just that: a generic superhero film with hardly any real character development. It's a shame too since the first definitely wasn't a generic superhero film and it broke the genre stereotypes (despite being released years before the modern 'superhero craze'). The film just sort of ended too, without any real resolution or closure, and instead of leaving me excited and ready for more, the bombastic score (taken from the original) and the once cool 2D credit animations (taken from the original) left me feeling hollow. 'Incredibles 2' is an incredible disappointment, and actually tarnishes the legacy of the first. Sure, it's not terrible and it's entertaining enough for the majority of its runtime, but as a follow-up to one of the best animated films of all time, it's simply not good enough. 5/10

title: Sad
review: The first Incredibles is a great movie, and one of my favorites. When I heard that Incredibles was getting a sequel I was definitely worried. I was worried that Incredibles 2 was going to be bad and be a huge disappointment... It sort of was. Incredibles 2 is probably the most predictable movie I've ever seen. If you think you know what is going to happen next, you most definitely do. For me, it was distractingly predictable, and that made the story very bland. That wasn't the only problem either. One problem that you eventually get used too, is that the voice actors are noticeably older. This problem is especially noticeable with Mr. Incredible and Elastigirl. The story doesn't make a whole lot of sense and arguably the two best characters, Frozone and Edna, are hardly in the movie. For young children this movie will probably be very enjoyable. Going into this movie with the expectation that it's going to be a great as the first one is a mistake. My rating for this movie is really more like a 5.5, but I just settled with 6. The movie did a few things pretty well. The animation was great, which is typical for Pixar, and the movie felt more like it was set in the 60s than the first one did. This movie is a nostalgia cash grab. If you go into the movie expecting dumb fun you won't be disappointed, because it is exactly that. There was so much potential, and Pixar really dropped the ball.

title: Take off your nostalgia glasses.
review:
We all loved the first film. It's a classic, it's great, but there are people giving 10s to this film, when really it doesn't deserve it. I always say, a sequel doesn't get points for having the original characters, but it does for what they do with them, but I feel like the characters have gone backwards this film. Suddenly, Bob Parr is selfish, and half of the film is just Jack Jack doing cute baby things because cute babies get ha has from the audience.

The animation was great, the sound was great, as up to the standard of pixar. But the story was so simplistic I really couldn't grasp onto it. 14 years to write a story! To put into perspective, Eraserhead took 6 years to make. 14 years, for this? I love Incredibles as much as the last person, but seriously, this is a blatant cash grab and I am saddened by the fact this sequel is now higher rated than the original. I hope those who gave this film perfect 10s are disappointed when they re-watch it on DVD release, because they'll realise they've been tricked.

title: Fine
review: It was fine but was really uninspired and relying on nostalgia

title: Should I care about the social justice nonsense?
review: I'll start by saying I don't like movie reviews that can't speak to the substance of the art while perhaps disagreeing with the message. That being said, there is definite social justice garbage being pedaled in this movie (female empowerment over men who are all a bunch of idiots, gender role switches, "illegal" social classes, etc.), and those are a part of why I was bored with the movie. But the main reason I that I felt like this movie went nowhere. All of the subplots never played out (Helen upstaging her husband, the villain's absurd and elaborate motivation). The only funny moments involved the baby. The worst part was that the movie was just too long. Not as good as the original, but not a terrible movie. Pixar has done far better sequels.

title: Thoroughly unimpressed; propaganda on full display
review: I don't typically write reviews unless I really love a movie or I really don't love a movie. Unfortunately, Inc2 falls in the latter category. It's not a horrible movie, but it's nothing new and had more negatives than positives. I really feel like Hollywood is running out of new ideas and so has taken the easy route of regurgitating and recycling old stuff. Furthermore, I'm slightly perturbed by the fact that critics refuse to give an honest critique of Pixar's movie. The last few Pixar creations left a lot to be desired. Finding Dory and Incredibles 2 both have a 94% rating on RT. Seriously? Both movies are mediocre at best. Lastly, I wish, that just once, Hollywood was capable of producing a movie without injecting their generally leftist views front and center. Is it too much to ask for a movie void of all the political propaganda that plagues us daily? Incredibles 2 falls right in line with the status quo by pushing the current political agenda: feminism. Hey, I'm a woman and I'm all for women empowerment. But not at the expense of belittling and emasculating men. Why can't we empower women without portraying men in a negative light? Why can't both men AND women be strong and powerful?

title: They made this movie for us!!
review: I'm 25 and they made this movie for me and my age group! We've been waiting for so long! And Sam Jackson was right! It was worth the wait! The fight and action scenes were intense and more dangerous! The humor was outstanding! The story amazing! Hit me right in the feels! I loved every second of this movie! Probably my favorite movie of 2018 so far!

title: just as good as first increadible
review:
The action scenes are simply amazing.
The comedy is great.
The dialogue is great.
The movie just oozes style.
More could have been done with the villain but the villain was still pretty good.

title: An Incredible Sequel
review: 14 years after the original, I wondered if a follow-up would be able to live up to the hype for all the millions of people begging for a second Incredibles movie. Incredibly (I'm not sorry), The Incredibles 2 is one of those sequels that not only lives up to its name, but is far better than the first movie. Even though it takes place immediately where the original story left off, it seems to have grown up with those of us who were kids a decade and a half ago, asking interesting questions for us to ponder and remaining more than relevant for today's audience. Looking at Cars 3 and Toy Story 3 (and soon to be Toy Story 4!), I like to imagine we might get an Incredibles 3. I just hope we don't have to wait another 14 years for it to happen.

title: What can I say but Incredibles 2 is Incredible. It contains great action, comedy, and relatable family dynamics
review:
Yep, I get to talk about The Incredibles this week. It's already well known as a great animated movie from Pixar & Disney, a fun superhero action story, and is even presents a more typical family. Not too sweet like the Waltons and not too cynical like the Simpsons. The Incredibles or the Parr family don't hide that they have problems, mostly learning to deal with the outside world, but manage to work together to get through life, whether it's a new super villain or helping their son succeed at school. The Incredibles may have been the closest thing to a "realistic" family from Disney, despite their super powers.

Many fans have been wanting a sequel, but faced a lot of challenges. Not only did director Brad Bird insist on coming up with a story up to his standard, but the fact that superhero movies have become more common and even overblown. When the original came out, superheroes were only out sporadically. So how do you go about making an Incredibles sequel while standing out in a market currently dominated by Marvel and D.C.? Well based on how good Incredibles 2 is, I'm pleased to say that were able to build not only on it's own superhero ideology, but it's commentary on family and suburban life.

Taking place immediately after the end of the first one, the Parr family, Bob "Mr. Incredible" (played by Craig T. Nelson), Helen "Elastigirl" (played by Holly Hunter), son Dash (played by Huck Milner), daughter Violet (played by Sarah Vowell) and baby Jack-Jack are once again forced to hide when they manage to cause damage attempting to capture a super villain. Bob fear having to take another menial job, but his friend Lucius "Frozone" (played by Samuel L. Jackson) tells him of a new opportunity.

Bob, Helen, and Lucius are taken to the office of Winston Deavor (played by Bob Odenkirk) who happens to be a fan of superheroes and wants to get their illegal status reversed. He proposes that Elastigirl fight crime with a hidden camera showing the work she puts in to save lives. They agree, which causes Bob to have to stay home to look after the kids while mom continues her superhero actions. Bob suddenly finds himself in a tough position from trying to help Dash with his homework, helping Violet with her crush, and dealing with Jack-Jacks multiple new powers.

I loved The Incredibles back in 2004 and I can say that I loved Incredibles 2. What Brad Bird understands about his family movies is that the most important aspect is the family. Not just with the likable and relatable family characters, but the problems they face and the challenges parents face. While I did think about that Michael Keaton movie Mr. Mom, Incredibles 2 showcases a lot just how parenting itself is a superhero act. Yeah, there's plenty of Craig T. Nelson looking tired and multiple bags under his eyes, but I'll bet a lot of dads are going to look at this and say, "That was just me a few weeks ago!".

Even in a market where superheroes are dominating the box office, Incredibles 2 still works as a superhero movie thanks to a lot of elements. For me, it's the action. Brad Bird not only knows how to play with a lot of the powers characters have, but thanks to the magic of Pixar and computer animation, makes the larger set pieces look great without having to make them realistic. This makes me realize that animation still has that advantage over live action movies in which it doesn't have to build it's effects in a realistic manner, making it's scenery looking seamless.

If I do have to fault this movie, it's with the villain. While I won't say who it is, Disney attempts to throw another character who initially isn't a suspect but later reveals themselves. Not only is this becoming a trope that I'm getting sick of, but isn't as interesting as Syndrome from before. At least Syndrome had more of a personal connection to Mr. Incredible. The Screenslaver has their moments, but again, when it's revealed, the motivation doesn't make a lot of since. What does help is the action in the final act, which is a boat chase that puts Speed 2: Cruise Control to shame.

I'll give this nine Incredibles logos out of ten. Incredibles 2 is such a relatable story and really funny that I have hard time finding people that won't like this movie. Brad Bird really is incredible making this movie. So put on your make and fly with this movie.

title: the incredible sequel
review: 14 years have passed since Pixar and Brad Bird brought the first part of this film and if one thing Brad Bird knows is making a good movie and it is understood why it took so many years to connect with the sequel had to bring not only a movie with animated advances, I also had to have a plot with a sense and emotion that we feel in The Incredibles, Ratatouille and The Iron Giant, The Incredibles 2 is not just about being an animated superhero movie, it is about generating awareness under parental responsibilities,, it's about balanced feminine empowerment and it's about generating awareness about the obsession we have with technology, all accompanied by an excellent music of Michael Giacchino that reminds you of the espionage music of the 60's-70's, It has small visual details that bothered me but not enough so that I do not continue to love her, in conclusion an extremely funny movie, with great action stories and great history that despite making animated manages more real problems than other superheroes this year and is something that you definitely can not miss.

title: A sequel worth waiting for
review: I have been quick to criticize Pixar's recent infatuation with sequels. We did not need another Cars or Monsters Inc, and we certainly did not need another Finding Nemo. I want them to tell original stories...not recycle old ones. And this one is a tad predictable and old fashioned. But you know what? It is hard to criticize sequels when they are THIS good. It would have been so easy to make the second Incredibles an action-fest of family crime fighting, but this movie managed to remember what made the first film so great: fully realized characters and one of the most realistic family dynamics ever captured on screen. From the marital tensions to the sibling bickering, you know these people. And the writing is JUST as strong this time around. It means you care, and it means you recognize yourself, and it means you laugh. This film is not about new villains so much as it is about new angles on rich characters. Fifteen years after the first Incredibles, we are awash with super hero movies. Sometimes it seems like they are all Hollywood cares about. But few of them are this good. Pixar nailed it the first time around, and this sequel absolutely nailed it too.

title: Worth the wait!
review: I took my 4.5 year old to see this movie yesterday. It was her first time in a theater. We saw it in 3D. It was great how they continued the story line then it took off on its own. The story line had a few surprises, but the animation is what was, well... Incredible! Great family fun. My daughter is already asking when we can watch it at home.

title: Buenísima
review: Simplemente asombrosa y graciosa. Increíble película.

title: Incredible! AGAIN
review: We've had to sit through two terrible Cars sequels, an amazing Toy Story finale, a standard Monsters inc. prequel, and a completely unsessessary Nemo sequel just to receive this Incredible sequel. Brad Bird returns to Pixar once again to give us the delight that was Incredibles 2. One thing I love about Incredibles 2 is that it doesn't pander to its 14 year gap and also doesn't saturize the superhero films that have since preceded it, giving us a great colorful continuation to the first film. The family dynamic still resides and the animation looks much more impressive since the last time. It also feels great to hear Nelson, Jackson, Hunter, and Bird in their classic roles once again. The action looks as if it could've taken place in a Live Action Film, which is a wonderful accomplishment. My one complaint with the entire film is the terrible villain ScreenSlaver and the horrible twist of Evelyn being her. I knew from the get go she would be the villain which made me sad, because Syndrome is such a great enemy from the first, but if you look past that you'll find a fun wholesome superhero film that despite its villain more than lives up to the original.

title: Its good, not great
review:
Pros Dialogue is pretty good Visually stunning Great acting

Cons Humor falls flat at times Forgettable music Pacing at times

Full Review- Https://youtu.be/Gw_Gy0SvX7M

title: They couldn't mess it up, and they did not mess it up.
review: Amazing! Go watch it! But honestly, we all know that it was going to be amazing and honestly even if it wasn't amazing, everyone would go watch it anyways. But it is amazing so don't worry, watch it. It's great.

title: Watch Hancock for plot ideas, oh, they already did!
review:
I guess my level of expectation was too great for this because I was left disappointed..

No problems with the exceptional animation, computers are great tools. No problem with the voice acting, as ever, a brilliant performance. But story, oh my, I really hoped they would do more with the previous movies ending, but alas no.

I can't help but wonder how they ended up with such a blatant copy of the Hancock story, which by the way is a great movie. They did, and then the rest was same old same old.

This may be lowest rating I have ever given and it was mainly because after watching a movie should not be a moment of; why did I bother!

title: Poor sequel
review:
Like many, I was really excited when I heard a couple of years back that a sequel to the Incredibles was in the works. The first film was brilliant, packed with punchy lines and witty humour really emphasising what Pixar do best. I just want to say I think Pixar is amazing, always delivering even on sequels- no need to mention Toy Story 2 and Toy Story 3. However, I left the cinema feeling disappointed and underwhelmed by the plot that didn't hold the character and uniqueness of the first film. 
The introduction of so many new superheroes was completely unnecessary, and the main plot I think many will agree was very poor and predictable, with unfunny dialogue. The film does continue straight from where it left off with the Incredibles having to fight the Underminer, but this was very short, only about 15 mins of the film. The main plot is Elastigirl having to fight crime in order to prove that supers should be made legal, whilst Mr Incredible has to stay at home and look after the kids. The plot is very disjointed and packs far too much in leaving it a manic mess, with no charm and appeal to it. The whole Screenslaver thing was a terrible idea, just the name lacking any imagination and you would think Pixar should have been able to think of something much better, considering the amount of time and money they have spent on this film. There are several similarities between this movie and the Fantastic Four- Elastigirl is frozen like Mr Fantastic and she unlocks a door like him by putting her hand through the underneath. The villain, Evelyn Dever, is an extremely weak and boring character, especially if compared to Syndrome. If you look at past Pixar villains they each have a very individual character- e.g. Randall and Charles Muntz, but there was nothing remotely unique about her, making her a very forgettable character. Even the appearance of Edna Mode couldn't save this film, her lines not nearly as funny or clever as in the first film, her character not the same as before. 
The climax of the film is bad and at the end of the movie, loose ends aren't tied up- the Underminer is still free. 
There are a few good moments in this film such as Bob's efforts to help Dash with his homework, looking after Jack-Jack and trying to help Violet in her boyfriend crisis. I am not saying this film is terrible, just it does not live up to the extremely high standards set by the fist. Some may enjoy it but I do believe Pixar could have done something much better than this. Perhaps this could have been improved with the inclusion of more characters from the first film, like Mr Huph and Mirage and less new ones. Also, since when do Disney films have swearing in? Overall, I would not recommend this film as it will probably leave you feeling disappointed. But if you do want to see it, don't see it at the cinema, it's really not worth it and would be better to wait till it's out of DVD or Netflix.

title: Not as good as the first. *Plenty of overrated reviews on here.
review: Like everyone else, I've been waiting for the Incredibles sequel for what seems like forever. As you would expect, after 14 years of innovation, the visual and audio aspects of the movie were fantastic. However, I left the movie scratching my head wondering how this was the best storyline they could come up with after all this time. Disney has taken a lot of criticism over the last few years for their overly feminist approach to story telling and unfortunately the Incredibles 2 is no different. The storyline will seem all too familiar. The meathead male lead is relegated to staying at home and taking care of the household duties and children while the more intelligent and empowered female lead is off saving the world. The story itself seemed long and at times uninteresting. The magic of the first movie is long lost. The strangest part of the whole experience was the Japanese short film before the feature. Why? Also, in my theatre, they played a Lego Movie 2 preview. - LOL. If the preview is any indication, and based on Lego 1 I'm sure it is, we haven't seen anything yet with respect to the over the top feminist / anti-male approach to storytelling.

title: 24 years old and have been wating for this movie since 2004!
review:
Some reviews on here forget that this is a kids movie. I was 10 when I saw the first one, and seeing this as a 24 year old was just as good as I could have imagined. IT WAS AWESOME!

Yes the plot is similar, but having all the old characters back, backed with strong dialogue and music score - this movie Is everything I wanted it to be.

Entertaining from start to finish I think it's a shame that some viewers critique it for no real reason.

Amazing movie, will watch 100 times, and can't wait for the 3rd one - WHAT HAPPENS TO THE UNDER MINER!?!?!?!?

title: (I know this is a cliche, but) It was worth the 14 year wait
review: (The) Incredibles 2, was my most anticipated movie of the year, and it delivered in almost every aspect. While the villain was slightly obvious and underwealming, the great action scenes and humor make up for that, and it is my favorite Pixar movie since Inside Out.

title: Great movie!
review: Had me laughing and with my full attention! Jack jack is my favorite!

title: Pixar's Best Sequel
review:
Yes, I said it. Toy Story stans can seethe. Incredibles 2 is by far the best sequel in Pixar history. After watching Finding Dory and Monsters University I was honestly a bit worried for The Incredibles followup. It had been so long since the original and many sequels made this long after the original end up being huge disappointments, and with a movie like The Incredibles, where it's near perfect and fondly remembered by so many, it's hard to truly live up to it.

The action set pieces were more thrilling than most live action superhero films and for once I felt as though characters in a superhero film use their powers to their full potential and when appropriate. Elastigirl and Jack Jack get the most visually inventive scenes and the bulk of Incredibles 2 action scenes and screen time. The use of Helen/Elastigirl makes for an interesting gender flipped version of the first Incredibles movie and in some ways she is a more interesting protagonist because she is more conflicted about her actions.

Although Incredibles 2 was amazing and a great way to reintroduce use to the rich world the initial Incredibles introduced us to, it is the lesser of the two, but both films have their strengths and weaknesses and Incredibles 2 relies more on the smaller character moments and comedy than the overarching story like the first movie.

title: LOVED IT
review: Amazing movie! Doesn't lose your attention for a second. Hilarious and intense. Worth 14 years of waiting

title: 14 years worth the wait
review:
I loved the first Incredibles film that came out in 2004, I wondered for years if there would ever be a sequel, the first one was a superhero film and at the same time a sort of satire of a superhero film.









Craig T. Nelson and Holly Hunter get back in there roles pretty easily, so does Samuel L. Jackson has Fro Zone. Also some other new super characters in which I hope they get there own spin off movie. The animation is even better then the last film. Action scenes are also great. All the characters shine here, even baby Jack Jack who steals most of the movie. Will there a 3rd film, I don't know, we will probably have to wait another 14 years. But this was an Incredible sequel.

title: Best Pixar Movie To Date!
review:
Incredibles 2 is the by far the greatest Pixar movie ever. Now that is a big statement, but with the incredible (No pun intended) animation, sound design and writing this is a pretty great deal. The only problem was the high amount of strobe (which means fast flashing lights that can give seizures) and the fact that some parts of the movie's story were hard to follow. Some curse words make it less suitable for audiences under 5, however they are brief and hard to hear. There are also jump scares, which aren't to bad but can still scare children, and loud parts, which I saw most kids in the theatre covering their ears during these.

Overall though Incredibles 2 deserves praise for it's incredible audio design. It is very fluid and easy to hear the characters because they don't sound like their mumbling all the time. The animation has no faults that I could see, (and I have pretty prone eyes) in the action scenes the animation really shows off being very realistic. The physics make absolute sense, and even though you can tell it's animated it stays close to real-world physics and makes you think your looking at real fighting scenes.

Thank you so much for sticking around this long, now on to the big one. Story. While hard to follow at some points, the story is awesome. It has twists, turns, and conspiracies. Now I won't spoil it but it is an exciting rollercoaster ride watching this movie. There are side missions building up to the largest battle like in every superhero movie. But this one does the best job at that. Better than any movie I've ever seen. I would give this movie a 5/10 if it was just preformed by two boys in a garage playing a puppet show with the same story. Highly recommend this movie to people who like twisty stories. Which is almost everyone.

Please give me your feedback on this review by saying whether or not it was helpful. Thank you so much and I hope you enjoy the movie if you go.

Best Wishes, Robbie

title: Don't let us wait 14 years for Incredibles 3!!!
review: This movie was outstanding! So much better than the first one, with a lot deeper involved plotting! 10/10 for sure!

title: Excellent sequel
review: Loved this one even more than the original! So much fun. Husband and I both loved it as much as our 5 and 12 year old. My only teeny tiny beef is why the need for the couple of cuss words? Not necessary

title: Can't say I loved it..
review:
Incredibles 2 is the latest installment of the Disney/Pixar formula of making a follow up to a popular existing propertie, without any 
real substance.
The story follows the Parr familys life after helen/elastagirl played by Holly Hunter, is recruited to take part of a project to help better the public perceptions on superheroes in the hopes to lift the band inplaced on supers stablished in the previous film. In the mean time Bob Parr Aka Mr. Incredible (played by Craig T. Nelson) takes on the duties of taking care of the house hold while also being supportive of his wife's new position. He comes to realize both task aren't as easy as he thought.
 From this information alone you'd imagine a sold structure follow up. Unfortunately that's not the case... You have character acting in one way only for it to lead to a subpar or unsatisfying conclusion.
New characters are introduce that are highly forgettable. A very lack luster villain who's motives seemed very incoherent. Especially compared to syndrome from the first Incredibles.
Not all was bad though,
the animation was fantastic as what was expected. The action scenes were a lot of fun. And the real highlights of the film come from the scenes of Bob interacting with his family. But those are being held around a underwelming story.
I know a lot have waited for this film. Hell myself included. But what we got was a straight to blue ray premise wrapped in a Pixar level esthetic. The film is not bad by no means. But it isn't remember enough to go back to view it again. Especially when you have a better product in the first movie go back to. That's why I'm giving Incredibles 2 a 5 out 10.

title: Must see
review: Well worth the 14 year wait. Spent the morning laughing along And the animation has gotten better

title: The best Animated for the Summer . A family movie
review: Incredibles 2 is one of the best Animated movies for this summer . I loved the way they started and the way the they ended . You must watch . It is not boring , it is a little long but it is not wasting your time . A lot action and a lot comedy . Enjoy

title: The Incredible Incredibles
review:
Incredibles 2 proves to be another hit for Pixar and Disney. Released 14 years after the original, this film picks up from where the last film ended, and it never stops to take a breath. The action sequences are exhilarating and fun to watch, aided by a clear improvement in animation technology.

Incredibles 2 can never be as innovative as its predecessor, yet it keeps the heart and the fun of the first film. The story about a family of superheros sets it apart from the comic book films, giving us interesting family dynamics and everyday problems that all families face, which feels organic and human, allowing all of us to relate to this family and allows us to see them as not just superheros, but ordinary families trying to live their lives.

All compliments aside, the villain, Screenslaver, in this film was surprisingly weak and never much of a threat, due to a lack of opportunity for Screenslaver to truly develop itself. Unlike Syndrome in the first film, this villain never challenged the ideals and beliefs of any member of the family, although you could see where the villain is coming from, adding moral ambiguity, a characteristic of most Pixar films.

In addition, so many ideas about politics, commentaries about the justice and fairness are introduced throughout the film. While relevant, it can't help but feel over-saturated with different kinds of messages it wants to bring across. In the end, although the film was a fun and enjoyable time at the theaters, the muffled message makes the journey slightly frustrating.

title: Total load of rubbish.
review:
A movie designed for idiots who because they spend good money on seeing a movie don't want to admit when they have been ripped off and give it good reviews.
My recommendation is if you just have to see it is wait until it's free on TV.

title: Incredibles 2 Outdos it predcessor
review:
Watched The Incredibles 2 amazing voice Performances from Craig T.Nelson(Gold) as Bob Parr/Mr. Incredible , Holly Hunter(Batman V Superman:Dawn Of Justice) as Helen Parr/Elastigirl also starring Huck Milner as Dash Parr/The Dash , Sarah Vowell(Six Degrees) as Violet Parr , Samuel L. Jackson(Star Wars:Revenge Of The Sith) as Lucius Best/Frozone, Catherine Keener(Get Out) as Evelyn Deavor ,Bob Odenkirk(Better Call Saul) as Winston Deavor, Brad Bird(The Iron Giant) as Edna Mode and Sophia Bush(Alex,Inc) as Karen/Voyd.

The film is very Funny and exciting also me being enjoying the superhero sub-genre as well, The film was great also loved it was return to form for the Parr Family not to mention all of the characters were layered and nuanced and each had an arc also there was an exciting twist as well which was brilliant it was great hoping for a threequel.

Amazing score Michael Giacchino(Star Trek Beyond), Screenplay/Direction by Brad Bird(Mission:Impossible-Ghost Protocol ) Incredibles 2 Outdos it predcessor 10/10

title: Yeah, one of the best sequels ever made
review:
I gave this movie the highest rating because of one thing. This film's main plot is that the Incredible family are trying to make superheroes legal again by having the mother Elasti-girl carry out missions. There turns out to be another villain known as the Screenslaver about. The meeting to legalize superheroes is arranged by this one guy. My dad and I just knew that he was the Screenslaver. Then it turns out...it's actually his sister!

We seriously did not see that coming! Okay, I admit that by this point it has gotten kind of clichÃ© to have the villain in a Disney or Pixar film be a twist. Still, this was at least done better than most examples. Anyway, I thought this was even better than the original. It's great to have all these great characters back in a sequel that truly does advance their mythology. It even starts out as an immediate sequel to the first movie.

There's even this great opening credits gag done in the style of the show. What many people might not know is that Elasti-girl was also the name of a DC Comics character, but Pixar explicitly got permission to use the name. Don't worry, Disney will probably eventually own DC as well. It's great to see the more mundane scenes with Mr. Incredible and his family. It really does make the film realistic. Just when you think Edna won't appear, she does! ****

title: Incredibles is astonishing and awesome with its exciting visuals and lovable characters.
review:
Incredibles 2 (4.5 out of 5 stars).

Incredibles 2 is an awesome superhero sequel that matches up to the original movie that was released 14 years ago. Now, that was also a risky move on pixar's end since they do not have a good track record with making good sequels except for Finding Dory. While, the rest of them like Cars or Toy Story were kind of losing there touch that made the original movies so good. Sure, the story was good in this sequel which focuses more on Elastigirl doing solo missions while her husband Bob is a stay home daddy with Dash, Violet, and baby Jack Jack. While Elastigirl is on a trail of a new villain called Screenslaver that brainswashes anybody that gets hypnotized by his static coding on monitors.

Director Brad Bird is back and brings a lot of entertainment in his film. It has plenty of colorful visuals and the animation was stylish. The action sequences are great and exciting. The film follows right after the events on the first film when Mole man breaks through the city with his big driller. And the Incredibles family has to stop him. Which sets the plan in motion when the destruction makes the officials question if superheroes are even needed or do they create more destruction than just letting the bad guys get away clean. The train sequence was fun and exciting with Elastigirl chasing it with her motorcycle and trying to stop an unstoppable train. Seeing Jack Jack experience his powers when the clueless father Bob is burnt out from being a stay home father. While Dash is having math trouble and Violet having boy trouble. The family dynamic is a lot of fun and entertaining.

I do feel like the film slows down with the sub plot of Winston Deaver, a superhero fan that is recruiting other superheroes to help fight crime and to prove to the officials that society need heroes. The other superheroes that are introduced are forgettable. When the film backtracks to Mr. Incredible and his way of handling with the kids at home is back on screen. It is amusing. Or seeing Elastigirl back in action.

When it comes to sequels that lose its touch or is inferior to the original. Incredibles 2 lives up to the hype and is worth the wait. The pace is on going and fast. It does not lose itself with uneven characters being on screen. Elastigirl is more focused on in the plot. But Bob and the family are not forgotten and they have plenty of screen time when they are back in action. When Violet and Dash are to the rescue while bringing an uncontrollable baby Jack Jack. And Frozone is back in action when he takes off with his suit while his wife nags in the background again.

Overall, Incredibles 2 is a really good family superhero film. If you love the original, you will enjoy this just as much. Or if you love superhero movies, this one brings enough entertainment for children and adults to enjoy.

title: Better than the first one
review: The characters, story line, animation and etc; are great.

title: The libertarian marketing
review:
I have heard from the Libertarians that this is a great movie. I did not like the first, but Catherine Mangu Ward was very excited. She probably liked the *breeder housewife saves the world*, probably because she identifies with the character.

Inside I could not find the freedom talk. I have seen a story, like in all Super hero movies, in which the big government is corrupted, but everything will be made perfect with more laws and signed papers by people so important other humans can die.

I have seen an ode to the killer cop from the media. In which the procedure, the checks and balances, the private property itself mean nothing to save "the Ambassador". In which a woman with a mask and a hidden identity can enter no matter what home, break stuff, take objects, because she has a gadget with a screen and a flashing dot. In which evidence for a criminal trial is held and given as some sort of trophy at a fancy party. I have seen how nice is to spend big bucks to please governmental bureaucrats "for the good of everybody".

I have seen a feminist manifesto: the family can't get a nanny. No, the male should endure what was deemed humiliating for the women folk, in the name of equality.

I have seen a masculinist manifesto: the male of the family can't handle things as well as the woman after 10 years of hard practice, but this is only because he doesn't use his superior male brain. Once he starts acting like a man, everything becomes a breeze, and the woman's experience of 10 years is acquired in less than a week, as shown, simply overnight.

I have seen how the woman can't be a full person without popping more than 2 children, the 3 required for keeping a constant population. And, well, the evil one has none, because she won't do her civic duty to the king and country.

I have disliked to have seen the big nosed person that would sell anything to anybody. At least the character does not have a hooked nose, or the Star of David cufflinks, but the reference is there and is disgusting.

title: Laugh yourself silly and be pleasantly surprised at getting choked up about 'family matters'.
review: INCREDIBLES 2 (2018) **** (Voices of: Craig T. Nelson, Holly Hunter, Sarah Vowell, Huck Milner, Catherine Keener, Eli Fucile, Bob Odenkirk, Samuel L. Jackson, Michael Bird, Sophia Bush, Brad Bird, Phil LaMarr, Isabella Rossellini, Adam Gates, Jonathan Banks, John Ratzenberger, Bill Wise, Nicholas Bird, Paul Eiding, Barry Bostwick, Michael B. Johnson, Jere Burns, Adam Rodriguez, Kimberly Adair Clark) Pixar does it again with this incredible sequel to the original with expanded nuclear family of super heroes facing the fact that society has outlawed them until a wealthy, philanthropical fan decides to reboot them as a PR gimmick with the Parr clan facing down a technological mad genius from enslaving the populace at hand. Great wit, grit, charm, harm and heart concocted by the fervid mind of Bird (yep another Bird-brained idea!) keeps the motor running (and that rad retro score by Michael Giacchino) to full tilt near exhaustive concoctions with wild-card baby Jack-Jack as the scene-stealing munchkin with unknown 'powers' of his own (note to the studio - a stand-alone chop/chop!) Laugh yourself silly and be pleasantly surprised at getting choked up about 'family matters'.

title: Just why
review: Do not go see this. It is pointless predictable and ruins the first movie

title: Must see. Worth the wait!
review: Awesome movie. The characters shined through and the parr's were awesome once again.

title: Extremely mediocre anima(c)tion
review:
Here we have "Incredibles 2" and the title makes it obvious of course that this is the long awaited (?) sequel to the Pixar Oscar-winning blockbuster "The Incredibles". It's been almost 15 years since that one and director Brad Bird is back behind the camera after a journey into the world of live action. So you get the superhero family back for this film we have here that runs pretty much exactly 2 hours including credits, which is really long for an animated Hollywood film these days you could say. Let me say first of all that I am writing this review as somebody who has yet to see the original first Incredibles movie. While I like animation, Pixar and live action superhero films, the 2004 film never really made me curious to the point where I would really wanna see it. And I guess I was right as this one here left me really underwhelmed and I don't think the problem was that I have not seen the first. There are basically 2 almost independent story lines here. The first is about the father who stays at home with the baby (and the other kids) and finds out that the baby has superpowers as well that may exceed everything they have known about so far. The second is about the mother being recruited by an influential businessman and his sister with the plan to make sure superheroes are no longer outlaws. Well, I mentioned the kids in brackets. The boy is fun to watch, but has literally no story line whatsoever. The girl has a bit more, some references about a boy she is crushing on and who may have an interest in her too, but sadly found out about her superhero identity and thus had to lose his memory about her altogether.

Let's talk a bit about the father-baby story line. I found it really uninteresting. The daddy is sometimes fun to watch, also his face, but yeah it just wasn't enough to make for almost half the film. It was never really funny, not even remotely and in terms of the fantasy aspect, i.e. the baby's powers, it wasn't good enough drama-wise either to cut the cake. Good enough for a 20-minute television special perhaps, but that's it. The mother being out there getting liked by the people was definitely the more dramatic story line. But it had crucial flaws too. I really struggle to find the mother interesting on a level where I see her as the defining character from a movie. I see that in the father though. Plus her part was so packed with action instead of convincing story lines that it was just one heavy explosion or stunt after the next. Then there is of course the twist when we find out who the villain is. As if that was any surprise. It was obvious from the beginning. The only surprise was to me that the brother wasn't involved. I thought he wanted to summon all these heroes and politicians on the ship, so he could kidnap them or do something worse. I remember plot twists about villains that I really didn't see coming like in Zootopia or Frozen, but here it is really really easy to predict and still they are acting as if it wasn't obvious. Another problem for this film is that it has just too many characters. The Black ice hero is completely pointless, same for the superhero brother and there are 2 or 3 other characters that are getting a solid amount of screen time, but add virtually nothing. It's like the animated Avengers gone wrong at times.

Finally, of course with Pixar, it needs to be said that the animation is as good as always. There is really absolutely nothing wrong with the visual side. But the film relies way too much on that component and the heart and charm of other Pixar films is missing entirely here. Rushed-in story lines like the antagonist trying to convince the mother she is the more powerful from the couple do not work at all. All in all, I am surprised this received such strong reviews and is considered a frontrunner for Animated Feature at the Oscars. It has nothing on Wes Anderson's recent dog-themed film. Or on a handful of Japanese films coming out this year. If "Incredibles 2" is really top of the pile this year, then this says nothing good about Hollywood animation this year and they may be losing their dominant position to Asia again. The introductory short film by Pixar (about dumplings) was weak already and the full feature film that followed wasn't any better. It could partially have to do with the German dub that I watched not being particularly great to be fair, but hey that's part of the entire thing as well, actually a crucial part. So overall, the only thing impressive (as usual) here was the visual side. The rest of the film was not a success by any means and I give it a thumbs-down. For all I care, they don't need to make a third film, but I'm pretty sure looking at the reception and upcoming awards accolades they will. Not sure if I'm gonna watch, but I'm pretty sure I'll never give this second film a rewatch. Thumbs-down. Please please please get back to your best again soon Pixar.

title: Way better than I was expecting
review:
I liked the original Incredibles, but didnt love it the way many did (and do). (Gasp, shocking I know). That being said, Incredibles 2 is an amazing and fun movie unless you're just trying to hate on sequels in general. Story is great; a bit darker than the original, while maintaining a classy balance between humor and seriousness. Yes there are some political and social undertones in the story, but it incorporates them neatly, without going full-on SJW like The Last Jedi. I felt like they actually had their place in the story, and that they strengthened rather than detracted from the movie. All the main characters were superb and the animation and voice-acting is flawless as you might expect, with cheeky Frozone, unpredictable Jack-Jack, and charismatic Elastigirl nearly stealing the show by themselves. Genuine character development and motivations all around. The action set-pieces are thrilling and are easily some of the best that I have ever seen in an animated film, or really just film, period. No really. I thought I was in a Mission Impossible film for a second. Not that that's a bad thing.

Where it goes wrong: All the other 'supers' except for the main ones and one particularly self-conscious super, feel kind of random and unnecessary. And while the villain is perfect, the third act, while certainly passable, felt like a bit of a letdown. I felt like there could have been more, well, oomph, to it. They could easily have made it 10-25 minutes longer and nobody would have complained.

Overall, 9/10, well worth watching.

title: R rated adult movie disguised as kids film
review: Explicit violence and excessive alcohol use. Pixar has changed directions.

title: Incredibly Boring
review: I've never written a review before, but I felt that I should for this one. I'm sorry to say it because I loved the first film, but this film is so boring! The characters are disappointing and there is no development. I feel the treatment of Mr Incredible is not fair, he is trying his best at home. I appreciate that feminism and equality is important, being female myself, but I feel that it's gone too far. This film made men appear incompetent, and at times, is quite rude about men in general. I won't be watching this film again.

title: The best!
review:
Incredibles 2 is amazing! It is the best animated movie I have seen in so long. Every scene is perfect and made me laugh. Never a dull moment that makes you bored. I swear I laughed at every scene.
Jack Jack was hilarious and stole every scene. They portrayed a teenager perfectly with Violet. Edna and Frozone were barely in the movie but still held significance.
The only thing I hated was the Screenslaver's tv screens that flashed. Other than that this was the perfect movie after fourteen years of waiting!

title: Even I'm not a fan of cartoon!
review:
Ok I'm no longer a kid so now I don't like family movies, especially cartoons, such as "Cars" "Plane" or "Wall-E"... If I have to rate those, I may rate them below 5 stars. Anyway, I watched this movie, both of movies.
I like the idea when they create a villain with no super power, and the way they tell the story is compelling and suitable for both adults and children. For the fans who has waited for 14 years, this movie is something more than a precious gift.
For me, there's several things I like in the movie, like the fascinating lines which is so deep somehow, and the way the film teach the kids, even all parents the way to understand each other, and live for each other, so beautiful and charming. My favorite character is Violet (especially her cute annoying voice).
But, another hand, I do not like how the movie ends, the bad person is beaten so easily and not intense, so predictable. There's not so much of Dash's scenes and also his power was shown boring and short (I love the way he ran on water in the 2004 version) and some short scenes came out of nowhere but I don't like them.
Overall, this's not a bad movie for a not-a-cartoon-fan like me.

title: Jack Jack is awesome!
review: Decent carry on from the first incredibles, continuous funny one liners. Jack Jack is awesome and hilarious, and loved Edners appearance. #goals

title: Better than the original.
review:
I'm a big fan of animated movies. I didn't really like 'The Incredibles' that much, though, and initially wasn't interested in the sequel. I suppose the media hype and box office figures finally convinced me to watch it. I'm glad I did.

'The Incredibles 2' is so much better than its predecessor. It is bolder, funnier, more adventurous and more action-packed. And I simply loved the baby, Jack-Jack. He was my favorite character in the movie and I believe his character is strong enough to create a spin-off. The animation is very good, and the action sequences are fast-paced and well done. It is also a coming-of-age story with the kids Violet and Dash growing up. We saw a very different side to the Father, Bob, as well, which almost made him look like an everyday kinda Dad.

I definitely liked this one better. It was very exciting, actually.

title: A 1960s throwback film with conservative undertones
review:
This animated film, which is clearly a 1960s throwback, loosely based in 1963, carries with it the similar conservative undertones to the first movie. After failing to stop the Undertaker who steals money from the bank, Elastigirl (Helen), Mr. Incredible (Bob), and Frozone (Lucius) are approached by a male capitalist, Winston, a sort of Madison Avenue type, who wants to rebrand superheroes ("supers") and make them legal. He tells the tale of his father, who kinda looks like Andrew Carnegie, who he says "loved" superheroes, whom we find later he avoided going to the safe room because he thought that "supers" would save him, and he was killed by robbers. They are helped by his tech-savvy sister, Evelyn, and the family is moved to one of Winston's mansions he is "not using." Elastgirl is basically paid to break laws, since "supers" are still illegal, to raise the profile of superheroes. In the meantime, Bob becomes the stay-at-home dad, which clearly threatens his "manhood" as he watches his teenage daughter Violet and ten-year-old troublemaker son, Dash, and the infant, Jack-Jack. In the process, he shows himself as incompetent parent, while Edna, the fashion designer for "supers," watches Jack-Jack for a short time.

Ultimately, the villain of this film is Evelyn, who wants to make "supers" illegal forever as she believes, not wrongly, that they shouldn't be trusted. She believes she is doing the "right thing" with her hypnosis technology (which allows people to be controlled through special glasses they where), more than her brother, Winston, seeing him, whom she once call "Mr. Free Enterprise," as deluded and living in the past. It should be no surprise that she is ultimately foiled her plan, depending on media attention and having an ability to spread her message. Funnily, her plan is unnecessarily complex and she could have accomplished the same with fewer "supers." Even so, she is a bit more compelling than villains in other films, like the one in the first film in 2004.

It is with this, we get into the conservative undertones. Not only does Bob work to save his wife, Helen, who falls into the damsel in distress stereotype, but the capitalist, Winston, ends up living and is painted positively in this film. Instead, Evelyn is a more devious superhero than Syndrome in the first film (who was also a murderous psychopath), who wants to make "supers" illegal is painted as terrible. As all the adult "supers" are under the hypnosis of Evelyn, it ends up being the "kids" who save the day, and then they work together to prevent the ship from crashing into the city. It reminds me of what the character, Carmen, says in the 2001 film, Spy Kids (and a common theme throughout the films in that series), "never send an adult to do a kid's job." Some could say that like the first film, this film "celebrates marriage, courage, responsibility, and high achievement," which are inherently conservative values. Additionally, when Violet points out that Evelyn will get a slap on the wrist because she is rich, Winston chuckles at this and says that we do not know what "the future will bring," while the other "supers" seeming to not completely trust him anymore. Again, like in the first film, Bob is not totally faithful with his wife in that she does not tell her everything, like that Jack-Jack has superpowers. What does that say about him?

While I have my problems with this film, as I note in the above review, I still rate it as a 6 out of 10, because it is an effective drama and a relatively simple storyline. It ends with the whole family of "supers" (Jack-Jack, Violet, Dash, Bob, and Helen) speeding away to catch a set of criminals with machine guns, while Tony Rydinger, who Violet was going on a date with, since the first date was ruined by his mind being wiped of all memory of Violet by the shadowy government agent Rick.

title: Boring
review: Can't match the more superior first movie. This one is overly cooked

title: http://bananamv.com/incredibles-2-2018/
review: It's funny,educational, and quite enjoyable. In the director's heart, probably there is a big boy full of heroism and beautiful ideals.

title: loved the movie but there should have been a warning about the flashing lights
review: LOVE this movie so so much, it's so much fun and action packed, the adventure, the characters, the humor, the animation. It's all amazing and as someone who loves to see empowering and strong female characters, I really loved that they put some focus onto Elastigirl and let her be the hero! I also did love the idea of allowing Mr. Incredible some time to be a dad, I really enjoyed those scenes, they were hilarious and actually very relatable for literally anybody with a family. Minus the whole baby with the super powers thing. I have ONE complaint, but it has no effects on my rating for this film. The movie was amazing, that's all I have to say about it. But I feel like prior to the film beginning, there should be a clear warning for those with disabilities such as seizures, that the movie will have long scenes that display dizzying, bright, flashing lights. A fan of The Incredibles could have walked into the film, and they suffer from seizures, and without prior knowledge from anything they could have had a seizure triggered and that wouldn't be fun at all. Besides this, the movie is fantastic and I recommend it!!

title: ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE
review: I absolutely love this film definitely on par with the first one or even slightly better incredible story in credible script incredible casting thoroughly recommend this film you can watch it on your own or as a family it's a truly enjoyable and incredible film!

title: Nothing Special
review: It was a very blah movie. It wasn't really worth the 10 year wait. The animation was pretty good. I didn't like any of the characters. I don't like how the movie is set right after the last movie. Their voices sound way different. The villain's plan and motive made absolutely no sense. I just didn't like it overall. Very disappointing.

title: The Film We Forgot We Wanted.
review:
The story is pretty average, and it definitely lacks a lot of the charm that the original film possessed. Some more progressive undertones tended to feel a little preachy to those of us that are in the political zone, which usually ruins some of the "innocent magic," movies can have.

Kids will have no idea and ultimately this is a children's film, so while it is of course not intellectually stimulating it's still a fun ride.

Instead of a sequel, we got a video game. And now that we have fhe sequel I think the world is more complete... But it could have been much, much better.

title: Amazing
review: I love the first & second movie it was worth the wait!

title: Great sequel
review: Not many sequels can live up to expectations, but I think Incredibles 2 did an admirable job. One thing that annoys me when reading IMDb reviews, is when people call a movie, boring. Incredibles 2 boring? If you get "bored" when watching a film under 2 hours long, consider getting checked for ADD.

title: Pixar must have run out of ideas after Coco when all they have are sequels to The Incredibles and Toy Story.
review:
It's one of those sequels which insults everything that makes the first film great, like The Hunchback of Notre Dame or Mulan. Pixar's first bad sequel to a good movie since Cars 2. I love The Incredibles nearly as much as I love Toy Story, for about the same reasons everyone else does, so I don't feel the need to write more reviews for them. The Incredibles 2 removes any hope that superheroes would be legalized at the end of the first The Incredibles because the writers at Pixar aren't creative enough to give The Incredibles a new story with legalized superheroes, and all of the main characters are simplified, except for Frozone and Jack-Jack. Dash's only goal is to get his math homework done, which many of us want to do, but not something worth watching in a superhero film, and Violet went awry when she found out Mr. Incredible got Rick Dicker to make Tony Rydinger forget her existence, and not just forget seeing her in a superhero costume. At least it didn't ruin Syndrome, like how The Hunchback of Notre Dame II didn't ruin Frollo since this antagonist died in the first film.

I've always been offended by double standard where it is okay/funny for Helen to hypocritically become what she did not want Bob to do in the first film and Bob to mess up with dealing with the kids, but it's not acceptable the other way. A good story about female empowerment would not be afraid to give a female protagonist flaws. If you were worried about Vanellope going Turbo in Ralph Breaks the Internet, I would at least give that credit for having Ralph call her out on it when she got mad at him for ruining Slaughter Race for her, and Bob/Mr. Incredible would be right to be mad at Helen/Elastigirl for doing what he did after she told him to not do it. I guess it doesn't really help that there was no personal conflict between the second film's female protagonist and antagonist-Elastigirl vs. Evelyn-like the first film's male protagonist and antagonist-Mr. Incredible vs. Syndrome. But wait, there's more!

The Incredibles was a deconstruction of superheroes and how people in the real world would get mad at them for destroying things in the process of stopping bad guys, the dangers of capes, and villains who give heroes time to foil them by monologue, even having a scene where Elastigirl tells Violet and Dash that the bad guys they are facing are not like cartoon bad guys from Saturday morning cartoons. The Incredibles 2 becomes the genre of silly Saturday morning cartoons with none of the clever satire that the first Incredibles had. Many of the new superheroes in this movie, like Screech and Reflux, don't look like they could pretend to be normal and live a normal life without superpowers for 15 years when superheroes were illegal. Last but not least, Jack-Jack, who had but a few superpowers back in the first movie, now has any superpower that the story needs him to have. I'm glad to see superheroes be legalized at the end of this movie, but the Underminer is completely dropped from the story after the first 10 minutes, which I'm sure everybody who watched the first Incredibles came to the second Incredibles to see, and I'm a bit worried that when The Incredibles 3 continues from The Incredibles 2's cliffhanger where Violet gave Tony money to buy tickets for her and him, they will find another way to outlaw superheroes again.

title: Incredibly kinda boring
review:
The only great thing about this movie is the final fight. Seeing other heroes was cool too.

Now.

The rest of the movie was blah. It didn't have the same excitement that the first one had.

You already knew who the villain was. And when its revealed you can easily say "i knew it".

The animation and voice acting is great but that doesn't help make up for a bland action sequence and story execution.

Incredible 2 is not worth watching despite a 14 year wait. We could have waited another 24 and being happy with the first because adding this movie really does nothing to further these characters in any way or sort.

The development is basically none.

Incredible 2 is not a must see movie.

title: This is the best Animated movie ever!!!
review:
There are many reasons why I love this movie and it works. I can't believe I seriously had to wait 14 years to see this movie.
First of all, the animated action was excellent, the plot was excellent, and the scenes with Jack-Jack were hilarious.
One of my few criticisms about the movie is that they seriously had to spoil us with the fact the Evelyn Deavor was the bad guy. Her name sounds like "Evil Endeavor". I'm still going to keep my perfect score. I'm just nitpicking.
One of my favorite parts of the movie were the awkward scenes with Tony Rydinger. There was one funny scene where the Parrs were at "The Happy Platter", but Tony worked their part time because his parents owned the place. Violet was so shocked that he was the waiter that water went out her nose and she got really embarrassed
The movie is an amazing Family Action Film and I highly recommend it

title: Incredibly Mediocre
review:
While the animation and the fight scenes are wonderful, the story is basically just a re-hash of the original. Don't get me wrong, re-hash can be done cleverly, however this movie done nothing clever about it. Everything is almost the same except it's watered down and clearly not as mature as the original. Not to mention that this movie seems to be obsessed with baby jokes. Many people found it hilarious, but I feel like it didn't contribute to the story at all.

It's a good movie to watch on Netflix when you're bored, but artistically it's nothing special.

title: Mind-blowingly good!!
review: These people giving it low ratings are absolutely out of their minds! This film is equal to and, at times, better than the first Incredibles movie--and that one was perfect!! It is so rare for a sequel to measure up to its predecessor but this one delivers. The action sequences are stunning and original. The dialogue is witty and compelling. The animation is GORGEOUS. Honestly, there is not a minute of this movie that I did not enjoy immensely. If you haven't seen it yet, don't listen to the naysayers because they're flat-out wrong. Judge for yourself: I know you'll agree with me.

title: The Vidiot Reviews...
review:
The Incredibles 2

The downside to being in a super-powered family is that your siblings will always reveal your secret identity to your arch-rival.

Unfortunately, when the alias of the heroine in this animated-adventure is exposed, it threatens everyone.

When Violet's (Sarah Vowell) alter ego is revealed she withdraws from the spotlight. Meanwhile, her mother, Elastigirl (Holly Hunter), has ventured out on her own to prove to the public that superheroes are beneficial. On the home front, Mr. Incredible (Craig T. Nelson) has become the main caregiver to the rest of his powerful brood.

Picking up right where the original left off 14-years ago, this overdue sequel fails to succeed, or even match, its predecessor. Lacking sufficient laughs and worthwhile action, the script to this follow up suffers from serious lulls, recycled plot points and a lackluster villain.

Besides, the point to having super-powers is so you can fly away from your family. Red Light

vidiotreviews.blogspot.ca

title: Not nearly as interesting as the first one!
review:
I just watched the film, and as soon as it ended, I came here to checkout the reviews and all that stuff. Turns out I'm not the only one who shares the same opinion. This films isn't "bad", it just misses a lot from the original movie, mainly (for me) the action and those sick devices and machines that fought the incredibles.
At the start of the film I was like - "ok, someone wants to save superheroes from disappering, and another someone is brainwashing people, being a "bad guy", ok, let's see what this leads to.". As soon as the film developed, I started thinking - "ok, surely the brothers are involved in the brainwash.", and that pretty much ended the fun for me. Moreover, when the kids went to save their parents and the easiness it seemed to take off the masks, that for me killed the film. Where's all the action? Where are those crazy machines and devices that battle against superheroes? No, let's keep a boat from colliding to the city. It's still somewhat "entertaining" to see how they manage to save the city, that doesn't make it up for the film.
To sum up, this film needed a lot more work and action, maybe the baby could have shown more of his powers against crime and the enemies, maybe less talk talk and more action. On the other hand I at least found it very funny and narratively good.

Some great set pieces and amazing graphics this time around and watching with my kids was great as they belly laughed over and over. That's what I wanted, for my children to enjoy it. The sad virgins voting this down clearly have nothing better to do than bash kids films

title: Average-ables
review:
It has a few good moments. They explore the babies superpowers which is kinda cool.

The plot is a rehash of the first movie with the roles reversed. Mrs. Incredible (Elastigirl) is out being a superhero fighting crimes and all that while Mr. Incredible is Mr. Mom. She is the poster girl for feminism maybe. Unlike Mr. Incredible in the first one she is not sneaking around training or fighting as it would be too similar I guess. Superheroes crime-fighting is still illegal but Elastigirl will change that by representing superheroes as she saves lives with finesse while Mr. Incredible is messy with high property damage. Lives are more important than property dumba$$. The old company that deals with PR for superheroes, damage control and other such activities is being shut down by the government but rich eccentric brother and sister duo try starting the venture anew with this poster girl plan. The brother has a Ted Cruz vibe about him.

Screenslave, the villain is like Killgrave from season 1 of Jessica Jones. Hypnotism through computer screens is the MO. I predicted that Screenslave was one of the rich eccentric siblings. The first half hour and last half hour are decent but the first movie was better. Hopefully in the next sequel, if there will be one the 'superheroes are illegal' charade is done with and there is some kind of Infinity War.

title: Not on the top 10 list of animated movies 2018
review:
If you love animated movies like Madagascar, Ice Age, Despicable Me, Monsters Inc and Zootopia, you will probably find this one below par. While most modern animated movies miraculously manage to capture the attention of any age group, this story seems to cater to grown-ups, and the word boring comes to mind.

Most of the other movies I mentioned hardly lets you recover from one laugh before the next one hits you. There are in total maybe 3 laughs in Incredibles 2. It's funny how this has a higher rating than Zootopia (2016) which is the best animated movie of 2016 in my mind (and for once I agree with the Academy Awards).

I did like it slightly better than part 1 though, mainly because of the over-the-top baby. I recommend wathing it once provided you dont have too high expectations and provided Hotel Transylvania 3 isnt playing next door (which has much lower ratings, go figure).

title: Better than the first one.
review:
Incredibles 2 presents a great movie, with a powerful story.
I only have one and a "HALF" problem:
The "HALF" thing is how did Bob sleep with a beard and woke up without it? Well, it's an animated movie so I didn't care about it, but it bothered me, but my only problem is that the biggest event in the movie (I mean superheros being illegal) solved very very easy and fast, I mean they saved the world from villains are more dangerous than saving a train, and they didn't care, but yet I am going to give a 10/10 and more if I can do it!
Well the first one is better in somethings and this one is better in somethings, so for me they are both equal! I really loved it and enjoyed watching it!
I loved a lot of thing in this movie:
The characters were really amazing and amusing.
The sense of humor was really hilarious!
The story was powerful and entertaining (beside the problem I mentioned up there)
The voices were really fitting on the characters.
The animation motion was really eye-comfort, colorful and entertaining too.
Incredibles 2 is one of my favorite movie... Not only animated movies, but in general!

title: A solid yet, flawed film that doesn't fully represent what the first was truly about
review:
So I saw this film about a month ago and still can't make up my mind. You see I agree with a rating from anywhere from a 5/10 to a 7/10. Nothing more, nothing less. The film has undebiable strengths such as its action scenes and the majority of Mrs. incredibles scenes. It also has undeniable flaws, such as Mr. Incredbibles parts being so stupidly cliche and obviously being comic relief. The film also had some really good family diolouge, but it was extremely lacking. However what determines your review will be how you took the humour and cliches. This films humor was pretty hit or miss. For me it hit and it missed resulting in a 6/10 (subject to change). I think overall many parts of the films were charming enough to help me not notice its flaws, but it is by no means flawless. I decided to give this a 6/10 overall because while this films charm and humor that can sometimes hit the spot as well as some really great action scenes. It wouldn't be fair not to compliment mrs incredibles portion of the movie. It feels like an actual super hero movie and I really enjoyed the action diolouge and characters. Some people didn't like the villains motivations and some did. Once again im in the middle. Overall if your a fan of the oringinal like me, give it a go, it's one of those movie where you really won't be able to decided without seeing it.

Hope you enjoyed this review and found it helpful!

title: Not as good as the first one
review: Don't get me wrong, this movie is really good for entertainment, but I expected a lot more. Villain is dull but the story in my opinion is pretty good.

title: Not as good as the original, but fun
review:
When this movie was announced after 14 years, everybody was crazy and excited about it, but even though I liked the first movie a lot, I wasn't looking forward to seeing a sequel. And I was right. It seems like everytime Pixar does a sequel, they don't want to really do it, they don't put a lot of effort as with the originals, and that's what happens here.
The story is practically the same as the first one, but with a change in the roles. The villain is so preddictable, and his, or her, motives didn't convinced me. Sometging that didn't liked me neither was the beginning. It's some kind of flash forward, and then it goes to a flashback 5 minutes earlier...and then it comes back to where it started. In my opinion it was a little unnecessary, and weird. 
Even though, visually it was very impressive and had a lot of fun through the movie.

title: A fine sequel
review:
The family of superheroes must come together to defeat a foe more cunning and adaptive than anything they've faced before - never-ending housework, teenage angst management and unfinished homework (oh, and a villain who uses screens to control people!).

Picking up directly where the original left off 14 years ago, the family of superheroes have to deal with the immediate threat of the Underminer terrorising innocent citizens. They do so knowing that superheroes have been made illegal on account of the vast amounts of collateral damage during previous failed attempts to fight villains.

Family matriarch Elastigirl is therefore tasked to fight crime in an orchestrated effort by a rich fan to get people to see supers (as they're referred to in the film) in a positive light and make them legal again. The Screenslaver, a new villain who uses screens to hypnotise and control people, is on the loose and is using his powers to keep the illegal so he can continue his control unopposed. Meanwhile, Mr. Incredible is tasked to keep the homestead in one piece as Dash has maths homework to do, Violet is chasing a boy, and new-born Jack-Jack reveals more and more powers.

It's too easy for lesser superhero films to slip into an old trap - a big fight might look impressive but if we're not told what characters powers are (especially newly created and unestablished supers), the audience is left confused that suddenly Superman is throwing a giant S from his chest at General Zod (seriously, what was that about?!). In the fight scenes between supers, the ways in which they used their powers were always a delight to watch since the script allowed us to understand all those involved well in advance. In this regard, special mention has to go to a particular fight scene between Violet and a girl who can transport objects through portals. Your imagination isn't doing it justice; trust me, it needs to be seen to be believed.

Having directed Ratatouille, Mission Impossible: Ghost Protocol and Tomorrowland to varying amounts of praise in the meantime, writer/ director Brad Bird gives an eager and anticipating audience exactly what they want and so much more. Incredibles 2 is at least as funny, inventive and visually stunning as its predecessor.

Best Quote: "Boys are jerks and superheroes suck!"
