title: Oeiginal was better.
review: I had fun with this movie, better than Pixar's recent material. Obviously, the movie was beautifully animated, the action were very good. I loved the musical score in this movie. I liked most of the characters. The story isn't as compelling or as interesting as the first, was a little bland. The villain was definitely the weakest part of this movie. Some of the humor was less clever and original unlike the first movie. My major problem with this movie is, same problem I had with finding dory, was the movie definitely felt less unique and felt more bland. Overall, I think this is a worthy sequel to the movie and was worth the wait.

title: Great Adventure for Kids & Adults Alike
review:
This movie proved that a fantastic action movie does not require blood or people killed. You got everything in this movie - gripping superhero fights, car chases, humour, cute and surprising babies, adorable animals (ie skunk), decent plot twist, great family and gender-roles story, great character builds and arcs, AND a happy ending! Bonus for great animation! And maybe because it's not real, live action, I enjoyed how all the superheroes didn't take themselves so seriously, which made them almost more real or believable! Hmmm

Have to say I loved the top and tail too!

Top as in the short film that was such a treat for the audience and such a proud moment for Asians. Bao is directed Domee Shi, the first woman to direct a Pixar short! What a heartwarming story that sweetly reflects both hilarious and fundamental traditions ingrained in every Chinese person near and far.

Tail - the end credits were ingenious! Such out of the box thinking displaying thousands of creators in 3D using basic 2D principles.

What a great start to summer!

title: Excellent Film - Almost as good as the first
review: The original is one of my favorite (and most quotable) movies of all time. This one was excellent but didn't quite live up to the highest of expectations. Will still go see it again.

title: Not up to original, if pleasant enough
review:
It may be hard to recall now, but, it can be argued that the 2004 THE INCREDIBLES may still be the best of this millennium's Superhero movies. Fast. Bright. Witty. And, never forgetting the human touch. The passable sequel isn't just disappointing in comparison to it's stellar original, but, it ends up being just 'another' comic book movie in what seems like monthly installments of them.

The plot is simple enough. Superheroes have been banned, but the Incredibles family just can't help themselves in being do-gooders. A rich man Winston (Bob Odenkirk) and his sister Evelyn (Catherine Keener) agree to bankroll the family in order to rehab their rep with the public. The catch is they don't want the whole family, but only want to spotlight 'responsible' Mom/Elastic-Girl (Holly Hunter). This leaves Dad/Mr. Incredible (Craig T. Nelson) to play Mr. Mom at home with the kids, Violet (Sarah Vowell), Dash (Huck Milner) and Jack-Jack (Eli Fucile). While Elastic-Girl is out grabbing headlines, Mr. Incredible is stuck with domestic duty. While functional, the script just seems so...so ordinary (trying real hard to not make an 'incredible' reference).

INCREDIBLES 2 is genial enough. The voice work is fine (Samuel L. Jackson's Frozone and Bird's Edna Mode make return appearances). The production values are top notch, and Michael Giacchino's score groves in a 60s Monty Norman 007 Bond/Space Age Lounge kind of way.

Bird, Pixar et al. said for years that they didn't want to do a sequel until they found a screenplay worthy of it. The outlawed Superhero story is an old trope perhaps done best most recently in CAPTAIN AMERICA: CIVIL WAR and is the fundamental basis of the whole X-Men universe. And, did we wait 14 years to see Mr. Incredible change diapers and spend 5 minutes struggling over a math text book? It just seems small. More akin to a TV series like The Jetsons or The Simpsons than a big budget blockbuster. Because of the high production values and A List voice talent, it might be a stretch to call INCREDIBLES 2 to be more suited for the Direct-To-Video second tier Pixar/Disney offshoots - but, sadly, not too much of one. INCREDIBLES 2 is an okay two hours, but, Bird and company have to aim much higher if this is going to continue as a feature film franchise.

title: Not so Incredible pt 2
review: There are those that think that some movies should be "stand-alone" and not to be anchored with a sequel. It's a tough concept to subscribe to when, after all, a movie does some serious bank because of it's contributing factors such as originality, story, character development, special FX, etc., etc. I am not a gigantic movie buff, but if I reflected enough, I'm sure I can come with several as such. On the other hand, there are many sequels that equal or surpass the first, perhaps due to superior factors, and/or the the timing was just right to reach the right audiences and it became a "perfect storm" sequel that added up to a great sequel(s). This thinking is not just for animation either. I believe that one can reflect upon a sequel of movies (ie Rocky, Star Wars, Jaws, Pacific Rim, Nightmare Elm Street, for example) and come to the conclusion that the first was the primo. That's not to say that the sequels were all that helpless/hopeless, and may have in fact added to the future character arcs. But it would seem that once a Mona Lisa is painted, there is not a need for a Mona Lisa 2. Case in point would be Ratatouille. This was an excellent piece of animated cinema that contained a completely unique and innovative story, great characters and development, beautiful animation, and resolved excellently to it's conclusion. Could movie-land juice up a sequel? Of course. But would it be necessary? Another example is the Croods. And for me, the Incredibles falls into that category of "no sequel required". Was I2 a good movie? Yes. Was it a great sequel? Not really. Certainly the expectation was there when it was announced that after so many years a sequel was in the works. But I believe the challenge lies with "ok, we made a masterpiece, what can we do to move it forward?" Understanding that in some 14 years the industry has made exceptional technical advances, and I2 is brimming with awesome animation and visuals, the real work has to be in the story evolution, not relying on the previous movie's tropes. Now with that, the I2 team probably thought it may be better to revisit all of the original's plot devices so as not to loose anybody because of the 14 years gap? I don't know, I'm just guessing. But I2 really seemed like too much of a first movie rehash. All of the I1 plot vehicles were there with a lack of any character development or direction. Yes it was good to see Jack Jack use a bunch of powers, but the rest of the family seemed superfluous to the plot. It wasn't like we were able to see any different sides to the family so their entire time on the screen was uneventful. I1 had all of this cool inter-family dynamics going on, along with Bob's work struggles and his relationship with Lucius, the gov't crackdown on heros, and a great James Bond-like villain who kills all of the other supers...and all the other supers were done very well with cool names and nifty/goofy powers but it all worked. Yes, in I2 it was good to see Edna bond with the baby, but her short scene was also cookie-cutter from the first. And the villain was lame compared to Syndrome. The theater I was in along with my family was sold out. And I can count about 3 times when I heard any laughter or scene reaction. It was like everyone was waiting for something to happen and nothing did for long periods. I think many people may feel compelled to like the movie because of the great first movie and the 14 years gap. But it really felt like a letdown. And I can't stand that vocal lisp of Holly Hunter. Was it worth $12 to see it in the big theater? Kinda. Go, you will enjoy it. But let it not be over hyped, there was one Mona Lisa and Incredibles 1 was it. I give it a 5

title: Mostly Incredible
review:
After 14 long years we finally have a sequel to The Incredibles, a film adored by people all over the world. Brad Bird returns as director and the film picks up right where the original ended.

Incredibles 2 is easily one of the best movie going experiences I've had this year. The film has everything we loved about the last one from lovable characters, interesting themes and great action. Although the plot is somewhat similar to the last one but with a few changes, the movie is still a blast from start to finish.

I felt quite nostalgic watching the same characters that I fell in love with when I was much younger. This film focuses more on Elastigirl instead of Mr. Incredible so in a way we're getting the same movie only a bit different.

The action sequences were well choreographed and the stakes were kept mostly personal which was a good decision and that is exactly what Brad Bird does well. The score is grand and exciting which made the action more exhilarating.

Elastigirl played once again by Holly Hunter is fantastic and the film showcased her powers in several clever ways. Craig T. Nelson as Mr. Incredible and Samuel L. Jackson as frozone are equally excellent. Jack Jack the youngest child who was barely in the last movie steals the show by being extremely cute. Violet ended up being one of my favorites in this movie which was unexpected which resulted in Dash being a bit in the background having not much to do.

By far the biggest problem with the film is its predictable story. If you've seen the movie you probably know what I'm talking about. The movie is entertaining, funny and a worthy sequel but it's not without its flaws. Overall it's a great time for the entire family.

title: too little... too late...
review:
I gave the original 11/10 as it was essentially the Fantastic Four, X-Men, Justice League and Avengers before their time. But this sequel was too little and too late. It doesn't make sense to make a movie 14 years later take place 1 minute after the original? 
But instead of following from the momentum of the first, which essentially had the entire family united as ONE, it just went back to scratch, broke the group straight apart and reversed the gender roles of a single parent crime fighter. 
Super disappointing story combined with slightly strange voices from Holly Hunter and Violet (which just didn't sound right).
 I kept waiting for it to 'happen' but never did. Mr. Incredible and Dash were pushed into a baby sitting back seat role, Violet had her character arc completely reset back to the start of the original and the SJW, feminism messages of making it essentially a 'Mrs Incredible' movie just doesn't work... it would be like making Fantastic Four and only focusing on the Invisible Woman, it's a four person team, it wouldn't hurt to have them actually BE in the same scene at the same time??? 
Supporting cast was great in this one though- Bob Odenkirk, Catherine Keener, Sophia Bush, Phil LaMarr and Isabella Rossellini are some of my favorite actors with voices that steal the show.
 I give this one 5/10 and won't bother going to see another on the big screen, not now that live action super hero movies have caught up to the original, and in the case of Marvel, are now far exceeding it.

title: 14 years of waiting guys !
review:
Well I was 7 when I watched the first movie in the theater and was wondering for the next years why wasn't it any second movie cause it ended with suspence ! And now here we go !

I really enjoyed this one, it was so funny, sad, and reflected some real life stuffs that made me laugh or just sympathize. It was worth paying for, I would totally go a second time to watch it !

Some moments were totally predictable but it is a child/family movie so I won't be mean about it !

I totally recommend it to you : Take your kids, siblings, family, friends, partners and go !

title: AS GOOD AS THE FIRST
review: Absolutely entertaining and thrilling from start to finish. The way the story is told is outstanding with great character development. a very worthy sequel to the first. Storyline had a basic idea but a very very strong script that kept me hooked.

title: They did it again!!!
review: I don't know how these people do this but dang 14 years totally worth it. I mean not as good as the original but if I rate this movie on its own no comparison I highly recommend it. If your a parent who is very strict on what their child watches this movie isn't for you though but other than that great movie.

title: Not better than the first one !
review: This sequel was a good one but not better than the first , visuals are fine and the characters shown are decent enough .

title: Graphics were unreal, but it doesn't have my 10/10
review: So first off, I love the incrediables. I grew up watching the movie. As a 18 year old, who has spent the last 2 years studying Film and Media full time, the level of graphics that this film has is out of this world! So clever and well thought out. But the plot is one of my main problems! The story line is very predictable and annoying. It's almost like they struggled to come up with one, so they picked a stereotypical plot like every other super hero movie. Some scenes were very cheesy, lazy and not necessary. Yes, this is a kids movie. I am WELL aware of that! And I'm sure kids don't think about this sort of stuff. But I now the difference between a good movie and a GREAT one! It's safe to say, I probably won't be watching this again. Yes it's good, but it's not really worth my hard earned money, because of those little things. It's the little things that make a great movie!

title: incredible movie
review: The most fun super hero movie out there. it get's it, that super heros have families, too. what a challenge!!

title: Very worth the wait.
review:
The movie was extremely gratifying after such a long wait. The family picks off from the point where they ended the movie last time and slowly the gloves come off. The movie focuses quite a bit on character development. Mr. Incredible understand first hand how to do house work and he connects better with his children, frozone gets to unleash his full powers. The kids dash and violet work just as hard as they did in the original movie, except they seem to be a better team now. The movie's focus though, is on two characters, Helen parr or The Elastigirl and jack jack. Helen gets to experience the freedom of saving lives without giving a second thought and she meets her challenge. jack jack meanwhile keeps revealing himself and his abilities and learns a bit to focus them and listen to his family and also kick ass.

Overall, I believe there couldn't have been a better sequel. I am very thankful to the makers to have done it so very beautifully.

title: One time watch fun family movie
review: I liked the idea of movie as female lead and a super baby.Plot was predictable but it was fun to watch .I loved all the children's character.

title: Incredibles 2- Another winner for PIXAR
review:
Incredibles 2 is the continuation to the highly sucessful Incredibles (2004), and it is basically a direct continuation to that movie.This time around, Robert needs to stay at home taking care of the children, while Helen goes on a mission. The script, just as the first one is very solid, the movie balances really well the superhero elements and the family ones, this last one working really well, making the movie relatable.What makes Incredibles 2 unique comparing to other superhero movies is the themes that it deals, mainly family and parenting, overall it´s all about family, the superhero theme is basically secondary. The quality of the animation is terrific, the way that the characters move, the brightness, the textures, everything is remarkable, also worth mention is the production design.The action sequences are incredibly realized, thanks to the possibilities that the animation offers, the great sound effects and vibrant soundtrack by the composer Michael Giacchino. The whole movie is incredibly entertaining and there are hilarious scenes throughout. The only issues that i had were that the villain wasn´t as interesting or memorable as Syndrome from the first movie, and also the ending was a little predictable. Overall Incredibles 2 is a delight, it might be even better than the first one, i had a blast watching it.

8.2/10

title: Late release internationally
review:
This movie will be completely spoiled before it even reaches Norway. No way I can stay off the internet for more than a month!!

Dear Disney, we hate you!

title: Boring
review: Like other disappointing sequels, you walk out irritated with the producers. Way to spoil what could have been a long term 'look forward to' animation.

title: An average sequel to an above average original.
review: A surprisingly obvious villain ruined the movie for me. When the main characters are oblivious to an exceedingly obvious 'twist', I, as an audience member, find it hard to care for their plight. Overall, I found the moving entertaining- it just simply lacked the means to be engaging.

title: An entertainer of the highest degree
review: Its one of the sequels which was almost better than their first part .Be ready to be amazed by Jack Jack.The little guy sure is my favorite character of this movie.

title: Sequels CAN Be Awesome
review:
I went into the theater without expecting much - the trailers weren't convincing enough to shout out a 'hit'. In fact, the trailer just shows the supers as regular people doing regular things. Nonetheless, I HAD to go see this highly anticipated sequel.

When I entered the theater and the first scene appeared, I felt as if I was watching the first movie. It opened up with the same sort of feeling, which makes sense because it is, indeed, The Incredibles. Then, the sequel continues over from the previous movie, and everything started to escalate from there.

An action-packed movie with family fun, The Incredibles 2 is one of the best sequels to ever be made. Although many have stated their dislikes, and the movie does have its 'I'm quite predictable' side (I KNEW that the villain had to be... no spoilers on my review!), it can even be said that the sequel has matched the quality of its predecessor.

You will NOT be disappointed if you go attend this incredble movie. Well, at least I hope not.

title: I waited how long for this pile of trash?
review:
I thought the opening scenes were going to lead to something great. The Underminer is where they left off fourteen years ago, but it is a short lived event. The script slips in to the old "supers are bad" again which happened the last time. Huh? WTF? We already knew that "supers" were disliked but that was all supposed to change at the end of the 1st movie. Now you are going backwards again? That doesn't make sense.

The villain in this movie is terrible, it could have been amazing, but they made the motivation less than admirable. A good villain needs to have a complete hate of the Super and must have a personal connection. Take Batman and Joker? Flash and Zoom? Superman and Lex? Instead they come up with The Screenslaver? Who hates them why? Because they are Supers?

The Screenslaver hates Supers because their father and mother was killed when Supers disappeared. Supers disappeared why? Because the Government get rid of them, so why the hatred against Supers and not the Government? It was the Government which made them illegal. Doh! Stupid script.

I'm sorry, but this movie sucks. This is an example of terrible writing from people who don't get it. The movie could have been so much more but they lack the ability to tell a good story This is why Hollowood sucks these days. Everyone is a writer and no one seems to know what the hell they are doing.

Thumbs down and BARF on this movie.

The only good thing is the animation. The graphics are as good as they get from PIXAR. I do not like Jack Jack who ends up being filler and a deus ex machina to push the movie along and fix all the plot holes. Sure Jack Jack could have been a great character but when you give a baby all these super powers, then you lose motivation.

title: A fun, heartwarming superhero family comedy
review: I really enjoyed Incredibles 2,despite it being slightly predictable in its plot and a lot of Jack-Jack scenes being unnecessary fluff, despite their hilarity. This film successfully comments on gender roles, in a non-stereotypical and unexpected way. A really fun, and hilarious movie I would highly recommend!

title: Brilliant
review: Worth waiting all those years. They did not disappoint! Just as good, if not better than the first. Well done!

title: Recycled 'magic' from the first movie that leaves you flat
review: I'm such a big fan of the original movie and all the sequel did was try to recycle the same 'magic' from the first, but with nothing original. There's no compelling family story that's unique and the 'bad guy' is obvious. There's a lot of focus on Jack-Jack, but the original short was WAY funnier on how they handled it. Worst of all, Edna did not have one funny line. Lame writing, OK movie.

title: Remember how you felt after "Independence Day 2"?
review:
2016. After a twenty-year gap, a sequel to the original "Independence Day" is finally released. Audiences flock to see "Independence Day: Resurgence," only to leave asking "20 years, and THIS is the best they could do?" "Incredibles 2" was NOT as bad as that, but it tried.

You'd think with 14 years to work on it, they could have come up with better than this. Director Brad Bird always said he wouldn't make a sequel to his brilliant original "Incredibles" until the right script could be developed. Don't think that the release of this film means it did; he just decided not to wait any longer.

A tired rehash of the original movie, albeit with new Jack-Jack antics and poop jokes thrown in, "Incredibles 2" indulges in the already-worn-out-its-welcome Hollywood trope of "Let's do the same thing , but this time with a WOMAN!" It didn't work for "Ocean's 8," it didn't work for "Estrogen Ghostbusters," and it didn't work here. There's nothing wrong with putting Elastigirl in the action, but if her character is not developed in the process (while simultaneously diminishing the character of Mr. Incredible) then it's just a pointless indulgence.

Combine that with an oversupply of subplots muddying things, and you end up with a movie that sorely lacks its predecessor's inventiveness and heart, or even its fast-paced storyline.

Nevertheless, this movie will make tons of money, from kids who will be attracted to the flashy action sequences (but who WILL likely squirm and whine during some excessively-long pillow talk between Bob and Helen) and the adults who liked the first one and go to see this sequel out of nostalgia. Inevitably, there will be a third in the franchise, though likely WITHOUT Bird at the helm, and even more likely without the 14-year gap. Let's hope it is more like the original.

title: It is not so incredibles
review: Just that nowadays we have so many superhero movies. The first one was wow when i walked out from the theatre. But this one it was like umm not that great. I don't see any super show off! The story is great but I expected more of 14 years

title: Seen it
review: Very funny jokes ha ha, with being said, very predictable movie.

title: Amazing movie.
review: Brad Bird is a genious!!! Thank you for making this movie. This movie was absolutely amazing, funny, and references the first. Edna being my favorite character, I loved her role in the movie, although it was small. This movie was carefully thought and played out. Stop giving this movie a 5 and give it a 10 because your not a true incredibles Disney fan if you though this movie was horrible! Sorry. Every joke, character was played out truly to who they are. This was amazing, thank you to the directors and cast!!!

title: Totally worth the wait!
review:
It's finally here! After 14 years of waiting for a sequel we wanted, and they have it to us, and it was Incredible! 
They did a wonderful job following up from the first movie, especially with continuity. The characters are still great, Mr Incredible and the Younger Incredibles show a bit more development, especially Jack-Jack, who pretty much stole the show. Story was good too. This time they're literally faced with the opposition the world has of Supers saving the world, and it was a good turnout. I highly recommend watching it.

title: An average movie with a duration above average
review:
Let's start by saying that I really loved the first movie. It was funny, clever, with great character development, personal stories and last but not least it was technically impeccable for 2004.

So... my expectations for the sequel were quite high but not unjustified... I think.

The studio had nearly 14 years (!) to develop something that could have been really outstanding. Everything was at reach of hand: Violet love story, Dash school adventures, Jack's power development, marriage crysis, etc. etc.

So what we got: REUSED IDEA - Helen and Bob just switched their involvement NO CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT - all the characters had nothing to say SAME VILLAIN REASONS - delusion LESS INNOVATION - boring inventions A FEW FUNNY MOMENTS A 2 HOURS LONG MOVIE, that could be easily shrinked to 80 minutes. NO REAL REASON to SEE it in 3D

Sorry to say that but it was quite boring and flat.

title: All ages
review: Is an all ages delightful movie, is a stunning adventure that brings up the best characters from Pixar, so far this the funniest Pixar movie.

title: Incredible!
review:
I love this movie! Jack-Jack is so cute and hilarious. The story is exciting and fascinating.

The tone seems different, and the style is a little bit different too. Sometimes the dialogue is too rigid stiff compare to Incredibles 1. I feel that an independent Pixar may be better.

title: So. Much. Fun!
review:
Thank you, thank you, thank you! 
Jack Jack was my favorite and now it's solidified! Not sure if fourteen years should have been the wait but I'm tickled it's here.

title: Watch yesterday in Spanish which was filmed For Russian Audience.......
review: Yeah I seen this movie, it was in Spanish but it was Russian audience originally. And yes I saw this over the Internet like many others have on this site and the others that saw it and rated it around June 9 to June 14. Yeah you can watch the on the Internet very easily. It was good not bad for a sequel I would say go see it.

title: Absolutely amazing and fun
review: I can't stop laughing from the beginning. It was the best animation movie I have ever seen.

title: Best Incredibles 2 movie
review: Incredibles two is awesome and I love it and Jack-Jack is cute and Family is awesome and I can't wait to see it in the Dvd and I love it awesome movie. Disney and Pixar is very excellent work for the movie. And I love the Incredibles!

title: Disney FINALLY Gets a Sequel right!!!
review: I loved the concept of the original Incredible. I could not believe it has been 14 years since the first one. The whole family went (17 and 13 year olds). My 17 has been taking graphic design in school and was quite impressed with animation! I can't say to much without revealing too much, so just go see it and have a GREAT TIME!!!

title: Amazing
review: It was a very funny movie that was way better then the first. All around great movie

title: Really fantastic
review: This really was about as good a sequel as one could hope for. The comedy factor is in even greater driving force than the original, and all of the gags and storylines really well written. This continues Pixar's strong recent outings and deserves to be seen in the same level as the original.

title: 14 years has officially passed by!
review: Ever since The Incredibles came out back in 2004, the ending made me want a sequel to The Incredibles. But after waiting 14 years, we finally got Incredibles 2! It definitely proved that Pixar can make one of the best superhero sequels to ever come out this decade, and I give it five out of five.

title: a fun follow-up
review: Shortly after their latest adventure, the Parr family returns for more when new forces of evil emerge but despite their best efforts, the government seems less than enthused about unleashing superheroes onto the rest of the world. When a unique opportunity arises matriarch Elastigirl is called into action, but can Mr. Incredible's over-inflated ego contend with the newfound responsibilities of being a stay-at-home husband? Despite the familiarity of the characters and any initial skepticism about where director Bird can take this story, it never feels redone or recycled but instead serves up a good showing with inventive action scenes, colorful new characters, and top-shelf vocal work, along with some interesting twists and sly in-jokes about feminism and domestic responsibilities. The film is more drawn-out than it needs to be, and some excellent supporting characters are underutilized, but it's a crowd-pleaser for sure. ***
